meanings.definition: The act of placing windows in a building.
meanings.sent1: During the construction, the workers focused on windowing to ensure proper placement of the windows.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the layout of the house, considering the windowing for optimal lighting.
meanings.sent3: The windowing of the new office building made it look like a welcoming place for work.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic windowing of the storefront transformed it into an inviting space.
meanings.sent5: The windowing of the school's classrooms created a bright and airy atmosphere for learning.

meanings.definition: The process of dividing data into smaller sections for analysis.
meanings.sent1: In data science, windowing is crucial for breaking down information into manageable parts.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use windowing to analyze trends in the collected data more effectively.
meanings.sent3: The windowing of the research data revealed interesting patterns that were previously unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: By windowing the dataset, the team was able to identify key insights for their project.
meanings.sent5: The windowing technique helped in organizing the data for a comprehensive analysis.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting the size or position of a window on a computer screen.
meanings.sent1: When working on the presentation, she focused on windowing to arrange the content neatly.
meanings.sent2: You can easily customize the layout by windowing different applications on your screen.
meanings.sent3: His constant windowing during the video call made it seem like he was rearranging virtual furniture.
meanings.sent4: The windowing feature allows users to multitask efficiently on their computers.
meanings.sent5: By mastering windowing, you can enhance your productivity while using various software programs.
